thread.title: Man wanted for questioning arrested after standoff
thread.title_full: Man wanted for questioning arrested after standoff - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Man wanted for questioning arrested after standoff
text:
NEW ORLEANS (AP) - A man wanted for questioning in a Baton Rouge shooting that left a woman in serious condition has been arrested after a standoff with authorities in New Orleans.
U.S. Marshal Kevin Harrison tells local media that 35-year-old Donald Williams was arrested Thursday afternoon after a two-hour standoff at a New Orleans house. Federal Marshals, New Orleans police, K-9 units and a SWAT team responded to the house during the standoff. Williams was wanted for questioning in connection with a shooting that occurred Thursday at a Baton Rouge Holiday Inn.
The victim, a 31-year-old woman, was being treated at a Baton Rouge hospital for life-threatening injuries. Baton Rouge Police spokesman Cpl. L'Jean McKneely says the woman is in serious but stable condition.
